reference: Volume Four, Issue Forty-Four, File 6 of 27
title: Conference News Part I
authors: dFx, Phrack Magazine, cDc - Cult Of The Dead Cow
historical_context: This article announces the HoHoCon conference, a significant event in the hacker and telecom community, reflecting the growing intersection of technology, law, and privacy issues in the early 1990s.
target_audience: Hackers, journalists, security professionals, federal agents, lawyers, cypherpunks, and anyone interested in the computer underground.
short_summary: The article provides details about the upcoming HoHoCon conference, including dates, location, costs, and a call for participation from various stakeholders in the tech and security fields. It emphasizes the importance of the event for networking and knowledge sharing within the hacker community.
summary: The article serves as an official announcement for the Fourth Annual HoHoCon, set to take place from December 17 to 19, 1993, in Austin, Texas. It invites a diverse audience, including hackers, journalists, and security personnel, to participate in what is described as the largest annual gathering of the computer underground. The conference aims to foster discussions on pressing issues in technology and security, featuring notable speakers from the hacking community. The article outlines logistical details such as hotel accommodations, directions, and the cost of attendance, which is kept intentionally low to encourage participation. It also highlights the conference's open nature, welcoming anyone interested in the topics at hand, thus promoting an inclusive environment for knowledge exchange and networking among attendees.
additional_notes: The article reflects the vibrant hacker culture of the early 90s, showcasing the community's commitment to open dialogue and collaboration in the face of emerging legal and technological challenges.
